languagesAndFrameworks.name: html
languagesAndFrameworks.description: The HyperText Markup Language or HTML is the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.

languagesAndFrameworks.name: css
languagesAndFrameworks.description: Cascading Style Sheets is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language such as HTML or XML.

languagesAndFrameworks.name: bootstrap
languagesAndFrameworks.description: Bootstrap is a free front-end framework for faster and easier web development.

languagesAndFrameworks.name: sass
languagesAndFrameworks.description: Sass is a preprocessor scripting language that is interpreted or compiled into Cascading Style Sheets.

languagesAndFrameworks.name: tailwind
languagesAndFrameworks.description: A utility-first CSS framework that can be composed to build any design, directly in your markup.

languagesAndFrameworks.name: javascript
languagesAndFrameworks.description: JavaScript is an scripting language used both on the client-side and server-side that allows you to make web pages interactive.

languagesAndFrameworks.name: react
languagesAndFrameworks.description: React is a free and open-source front-end JavaScript library for building user interfaces based on UI components.

languagesAndFrameworks.name: next
languagesAndFrameworks.description: Next.js is an open-source web development framework built on top of Node.js enabling React-based web applications functionalities such as server-side rendering and generating static websites.

languagesAndFrameworks.name: vue
languagesAndFrameworks.description: Vue.js is a JavaScript framework for building user interfaces. It builds on top of standard HTML, CSS and JavaScript, and provides a declarative and component-based programming model that helps you efficiently develop user interfaces, be it simple or complex.

languagesAndFrameworks.name: php
languagesAndFrameworks.description: PHP is a general-purpose scripting language geared toward web development.

languagesAndFrameworks.name: laravel
languagesAndFrameworks.description: Laravel is a web application framework with expressive, elegant syntax. We’ve already laid the foundation — freeing you to create without sweating the small things.

toolsAndApplications.name: vscode
toolsAndApplications.description: VS Code is a source-code editor made by Microsoft for Windows, Linux and macOS. Features include support for debugging, syntax highlighting, intelligent code completion, snippets, code refactoring, and embedded Git.

toolsAndApplications.name: git
toolsAndApplications.description: Git is software for tracking changes in any set of files, usually used for coordinating work among programmers collaboratively developing source code during software development.

toolsAndApplications.name: github
toolsAndApplications.description: Github is a provider of Internet hosting for software development and version control using Git. It offers the distributed version control and source code management functionality of Git, plus its own features.

toolsAndApplications.name: bitbucket
toolsAndApplications.description: Bitbucket is a Git-based source code repository hosting service owned by Atlassian.

toolsAndApplications.name: photoshop
toolsAndApplications.description: Adobe Photoshop is a raster graphics editor developed and published by Adobe Inc. for Windows and macOS.

toolsAndApplications.name: figma
toolsAndApplications.description: Figma is a vector graphics editor and prototyping tool which is primarily web-based, with additional offline features enabled by desktop applications for macOS and Windows.

toolsAndApplications.name: node
toolsAndApplications.description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment that runs on the V8 engine and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser, which was designed to build scalable network applications.

toolsAndApplications.name: npm
toolsAndApplications.description: npm is a package manager for the JavaScript programming language maintained by npm, Inc. npm is the default package manager for the JavaScript runtime environment Node.js.

toolsAndApplications.name: mysql
toolsAndApplications.description: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system. Its name is a combination of "My", the name of co-founder Michael Widenius's daughter, and "SQL", the abbreviation for Structured Query Language.

toolsAndApplications.name: laragon
toolsAndApplications.description: Laragon is a portable, isolated, fast & powerful universal development environment for PHP, Node. js, Python, Java, Go, Ruby.
